author: potuz
content:
Hello, is this true? If so, will it affect directly this server? https://www.theverge.com/tech/875309/discord-age-verification-global-roll-out
At any rate it is probably a sign that we should think on moving this server elsewhere in the future. Probably a good way of also encouraging to move some of the many private TG channels to the same venue

author: sky.cactus
content: It is true.  If you refuse to age verify, you will be considered a "teen" on Discord.  I haven't seen a good summary of what exactly that means, but at the least you wouldn't be able to click through NSFW spoiler tags.

author: sky.cactus
content: My fear is that people are going to use this situation to advocate for moving Ethereum R&D over to Telegram, which is totally susceptible to the exact same problem.  The "right" solution would be to move to a federated, self hosted, or peer to peer chat platform but the UX for all of them is notable worse than Discord (though still better than Telegram).

author: frangio_
content: have you tried Zulip? do you include that in worse UX?

author: frangio_
content: Zulip looks like a really well built piece of software, and it has all the right qualities (open source, self hostable). the UX is different and takes getting used to, i don't know if it's worse

content: have you tried Zulip? do you include

content: Anyone here familier with Ethereum Foundations bug bounty program? I submitted a report, it was accepted. And now im being asked to submit kyc docs. I just want to make sure the people im sending my info to are actually working for EF.
